entry.title: Orbx Kola Map Previews and Features
entry.summary: Sim: DCS. Threshold recently received exclusive screenshots of the upcoming Kola Map for DCS, and today, we have three more exclusives to share with you. The community has highly anticipated the new Kola Map, which will cover large parts of Norway, Sweden, Finland, and Russia. As of now, the project is listed as "coming soon," with the release of the early access version imminent. The Kola Map will first be available for early access and will be feature-packed with a multitude of airports. There will be two airports in Finland, five in Russia, two in Norway, and three in Sweden. Additionally, early access ensures a complete base terrain, highly detailed topography for the entire map, and lots of POIs, road and railroad networks, night lighting, and many landmarks to explore. Although early access will be available first, many future features have already been planned. Winter textures are scheduled to ensure the representation of the cold and harsh climate up North. A multitude of military airfields like Bardufoss and Kirkenes and a variety of civilian airports, including TromsÃ¸ and LuleÃ¥, are also planned. Also, general improvements to landscape features have been scheduled. The official store page for the Kola Map is now available on Orbx. entry.title: Majestic Software Posts Development Update
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Majestic Software recently posted an update on their forum regarding the progress of their aircraft development for Microsoft Flight Simulator. According to the post, the team has completely reworked the EFIS screens and custom flight dynamic for MSFS. They are also adding a new EFB, which will be included in not only the MSFS version of the aircraft but also the current Prepar3D version. Majestic Software has announced its intention to bring both the Q400 and Q300 for MSFS, and the Q200 is also highly likely. However, the team hasn't shared a specific timeline for the project yet. entry.title: Aeroplane Heaven Releases Hawker Hurrican Mk.1 for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Aeroplane Heaven has recently released its version of the Hawker Hurricane Mk.1 for Microsoft Flight Simulator, a British fighter aircraft that first flew in 1935. The single-seater plane was built by Hawker Aircraft Ltd. and was initially used by the Royal Air Force (RAF). The aircraft was introduced in 1937 and a total of 14.487 planes were built between 1937 and 1944. Although it initially flew for the RAF, it was also used by other countries such as Australia, Belgium, Greece, Poland, and more throughout its lifespan. The new add-on comes with a range of features, including high-fidelity models, detailed features, animations, accurate flight dynamics, a variety of liveries, and more. The add-on requires 2.81GB of storage space and is available on SimMarket for approximately $28.85. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: X-Crafts Updates Free E-Jets for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. X-Crafts have released an update for their freeware E-Jets, bringing the plane to version V3.0. This new version is compatible with X-Plane 12 and comes with many improvements and new features. The previous version (V2.5) remains compatible with X-Plane 11. The Embraer E-Jet family consists of a multitude of Brazilian-made narrow-body airliners. The project was initially revealed by Embraer in 1997, but it was not officially unveiled until two years later. In 2002, the first E-Jet had its maiden flight. The E-Jet family comprises of four commercial airliners, including the E170, E175, E190, and E195. The free E-Jets series by X-Crafts includes both the E175 and the E195 models. The new X-Plane 12 version of the E-Jets comes with a range of new features, such as an enhanced flight model, improved modeling, updated lights, cockpit fixes, and more. The new version is now available for download on the X-Crafts website. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: Parallel 42 Releases SimFX for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Parallel 42 has recently released its latest add-on, SimFX, for Microsoft Flight Simulator. SimFX is a visual effects utility that adds a range of immersive features and effects to the simulator. The add-on is compatible with a variety of aircraft and other add-ons, and a compatibility page shows what is compatible and what is not. SimFX comes with a wide range of features, including contrails, engine heat blur, APU heat blur, engine blast, wing wash, rotor wash, thrust reverser effects, engine pollution, touchdown smokes, wave effects, dirt effects, rain effects, auroras, and much more. entry.title: Stellar Simulations Releases Bacolod-Silay Airport for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Stellar Simulations has recently released their rendition of Bacolod-Silay Airport (RPVB) for Microsoft Flight Simulator, serving the Bacolod Metropolitan Area with a yearly average of 1.3 million passengers as of 2022. The airportâs site was initially used as an airfield during World War 2 but was abandoned immediately after. Parts of the airfield became a sugarcane plantation. In 1997, a Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) study indicated the need for expansion at four Philippine airports, and Bacolod City Domestic Airport was one of them. It was relatively small for the traffic it was getting, and expansion was impossible, which led to the construction of a brand-new airport. Construction started in 2004, with a 900-day deadline to complete it. During the digging work, the remains of the former WW2 airfield and aircraft wrecks were found. The airportâs construction was considered complete by mid-2007, but there was debate at the time due to a pending runway extension that wasnât complete yet. Commercial operations started in January 2008, replacing the old Bacolod City Domestic Airport.Â Cebgo, Cebu Pacific, PAL Express, and Philippines AirAsia serve it. â The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with custom ground textures, a custom terminal interior, landside buildings, an up-to-date ground layout, custom ground clutter, and more. â Itâs available onÂ SimMarketÂ for roughly $10.69, requiring at least 360.74 MB of free hard disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Verticalsim Releases St. Pete-Clearwater International Airport for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Verticalsim has recently released their rendition of St. Pete-Clearwater International Airport (KPIE) for Microsoft Flight Simulator, serving the Tampa Bay Area with a yearly average of 2.5 million passengers as of 2023. Construction started in 1941 and was acquired shortly after by the United States Army Air Forces to be used as a training base. It was returned to the County after the end of WW2, renamed Pinellas International Airport. Its current name only came to be in 1958 because Pinellas County was not a very attractive name from a tourist standpoint, according to the airport manager (people didnât know where it was). The administration spent $22 million on heavy renovation work in 2009, which included larger gates, jetways, new plumbing, and overall modernization. â Itâs an operating base for Allegiant Air, which flies to a wide range of destinations. Sun Country, Minneapolisâ local airline, also flies to St. Pete seasonally. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with an up-to-date ground layout, LODs for optimization, a simple terminal for optimal performance, custom static models, custom taxiway signage, high-resolution PBR texturing, custom aerial imagery, an official GSX profile, and more. entry.title: Thranda Releases PC-6 Turbo Porter for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. Thranda has just released their rendition of the Pilatus PC-6 Turbo Porter for X-Plane 12. Thanks to its superb STOL performance, and easy-to-maintain design, it is used all around the globe to deliver goods where regular aircraft cannot fly. With its first flight in 1959, the PC-6 Porter was produced at Pilatus Flugzeugwerke in Switzerland. It has been built in both a piston engine version and a turboprop-powered version and was also produced under license by Fairchild Hiller in the USA. After 604 planes were built, during a span of 63 years, Pilatus ended its production in 2022. â Powered by a Pratt & Whitney Canada PT6A-27 turboprop 550 hp engine, the Turbo Porter can cruise at an altitude up to 26.800 feet, with a maximum speed of 125 knots. This gives the plane a range of 1,612 km (870 nm) or 730 km (390 nm) with maximum payload. Due to its amazing STOL capability, the Pilatus PC-6 can take from a runway as short as 195 meters (640ft) and land within a distance of 130 meters (427ft). Thanks to its performance, it holds the record for the highest landing by a fixed-wing aircraft, at 18.865 feet (5,750 m), on the Dhaulagiri glacier in Nepal. â The Thranda PC-6 is a part of the DGS - Dynamic Generation Series, which takes full advantage of X-Planeâs flexibility and in-sim modifications. Some of the included features are: customizing a livery in-sim, changing instrument layouts with different panel configs, switching between different airframe configurations, high-fidelity and precise flight dynamics, and much more. Some of the notable features available in the XP12 version are:Â The EFB has loads of apps, such as the Aircraft Options App, Weight and Balance app, Instrument Options app, Dynamic Panel app, Static Livery app, DynaFeel app, Log Book app, Checklist app, Ground handling app, Dynamic Livery app, Flight Computer app, and more. Thranda Pilatus PC-6 Turbo Porter is available for purchase on the X-Plane.org store for 44.95$, requiring at least 4.1GB of free disk space. â Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight sim news!

entry.title: Skyward Simulations Releases DA-50RG for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Skyward Simulations has just released their rendition of the Diamond DA-50RG for Microsoft Flight Simulator. The DA-50RG is a single-engine aircraft made out of a carbon fiber airframe, mostly used for general aviation and training purposes. Introduced in 2007, it was designed to replace the aging single-engine DA-40. After the Economic Recession in 2009, the DA-50 project was put on hold, and by 2019, no model other than a prototype was made. In 2020, a new version with a Continental CD-300 engine and retractable gear was announced. Later on, it became known as the DA-50RG. With a service ceiling of 20,000ft and a maximum speed of 191 knots, the Diamond DA-50 has a range of 750 nm (1389 km). Skyward Simulations DA-50RG comes with an accurate 3D model, True-to-life definition textures, Custom-coded systems, including ECU & TKS, Ground Idle function simulated, Accurate flight model, Working Title Garmin G1000NXI integration, Included handpainted liveries, and immersive custom sounds by Boris Audio Works. This addon is available for purchase on the Orbx store for roughly $16.39 USD and will require at least 2.08GB of free disk space. â Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight sim news!

Since the last dev update, developers have been busy working on implementing Hydraulic, Flight Control, and Landing Gear Systems, as well as fine-tuning engine and flight models to match the Fokker 70/100 performance. entry.title: Backwood Studios Releases Eddsfield Airfield for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Backwood Studios have recently released their rendition of Eddsfield Airfield for Microsoft Flight Simulator, a little airfield in East Yorkshire. Edd Peacock created the airfield in the early 90s and is still in operation today. Offering a peaceful escape from everyday life, Edd wanted an airfield to fly from without politics, committees or hassle. Nestled in the Yorkshire countryside and surrounded by hills and endless green fields, it gives out a specific, calming charm.Â â Old Eddâs Trailer Cafe can be found in the heart of the airfield. This antique-like building offers a feel of how life used to be during the good olâ times. It doesnât matter if you came here to grab a bite between your flights, or to listen to stories from other aviators and veterans, Eddsfield is ready to welcome you! This scenery features automated hangar doors, animated people and animals, night lighting, custom 3D-modelled vehicles and buildings, a fully functional fuel station, GA parking, and over 50 km of custom-added roads. Eddsfield Airfield is available for purchase on Orbx for 7.52 USD and requires at least 0.97GB of free disk space. â Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight sim news!
